intro: Galium glabrescens, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often prostrate stems that root at the nodes. The plant features small, opposite, oval-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and a slightly hairy underside. Its flowers are pale green to white, arranged in clusters, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium glabrescens typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
